Sentencas: In this study we present the results of operando high temperature near-ambient-pressure xray photoelectron spectroscopy (HT-NAP-XPS) measurements of a pulsed laser deposited thin film Ni - Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-delta model electrode.
Titulo: Operando high-temperature near-ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and impedance spectroscopy study of Ni - Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: In our measurements, we have used the novel three electrode dual-chamber electrochemical cell developed in our previous work at different H-2 pressures and at different electrochemical conditions at around 650 degrees C.
Titulo: Operando high-temperature near-ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and impedance spectroscopy study of Ni - Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The possible redox reactions on the anode surface (Ni2+ <-> Ni-0; Ce4+ <-> Ce3+) were investigated by HT-NAP-XPS technique simultaneously with electrochemical impedance spectroscopy measurements.
Titulo: Operando high-temperature near-ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and impedance spectroscopy study of Ni - Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The oxygen partial pressure in counter and reference electrode compartment was controlled at 0.2 bar.
Titulo: Operando high-temperature near-ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and impedance spectroscopy study of Ni - Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Changes in electronic structure of the Ce 3d and Ni 2p photoelectron spectra caused by electrode potential and H-2 pressure variations were observed and estimated by curve fitting procedure.
Titulo: Operando high-temperature near-ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and impedance spectroscopy study of Ni - Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: The O 1s and valence band photoelectron signals were used for depth probing of the chemical composition and redox changes at Ni-GDC and for studying the influence of the electrochemical polarization on the chemical state of Ni-GDC surface atoms.
Titulo: Operando high-temperature near-ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and impedance spectroscopy study of Ni - Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: As a result changes in oxidation state of electrode surface atoms caused by electrode polarization and oxide ion flux through the membrane were detected with simultaneous significant variation of electrochemical impedance.
Titulo: Operando high-temperature near-ambient pressure X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy and impedance spectroscopy study of Ni - Ce0.9Gd0.1O2-δ solid oxide fuel cell anode
